22:06:24 SQL> 22:06:24 SQL> --
22:06:24 SQL> -- sparseness.sql
22:06:24 SQL> --
22:06:24 SQL> 
22:06:24 SQL> -- I use this query to help me see the frequency of r2m when ma-slope is very steep.
22:06:24 SQL> 
22:06:24 SQL> SELECT
22:06:24   2  ydate
22:06:24   3  ,pair
22:06:24   4  ,npg4
22:06:24   5  FROM v468hma14
22:06:24   6  WHERE pair IN('aud_usd','eur_gbp')
22:06:24   7  AND sgn4 = -1
22:06:24   8  AND ABS(ma4_slope) > 2.1*stddev4
22:06:24   9  AND ydate > sysdate -66
22:06:24  10  ORDER BY ydate,pair
22:06:24  11  /

22:06:25 SQL> SELECT
22:06:25   2  ydate
22:06:25   3  ,AVG(npg4)
22:06:25   4  ,SUM(npg4)
22:06:25   5  ,COUNT(npg4)
22:06:25   6  FROM v468hma14
22:06:25   7  WHERE pair IN
22:06:25   8  ('eur_aud','eur_chf','gbp_aud','gbp_cad','gbp_chf','gbp_jpy','gbp_usd','usd_cad','usd_chf','usd_jpy')
22:06:25   9  AND sgn4 = 1
22:06:25  10  AND ABS(ma4_slope) > 2.1*stddev4
22:06:25  11  AND ydate > sysdate -66
22:06:25  12  GROUP BY ydate
22:06:25  13  ORDER BY ydate
22:06:25  14  /
